title: Only one flaw
text: I LOVE this app! It is great because I use my mobile device for meetings and I can use my computer for work so, I like that it can be on mobile/Apple devices but the only flaw is, IT SHOWS THAT I HAVE NOTIFICATIONS WHEN THERES NOT SUPPOSED TO BE! Which drives me crazy! Everything inside the app is fine, (but I recommend changing the “you have to make people presenters when they enter the meeting” to “let people be presenters all the time”. The only thing annoying is the notification thing. And when I am on my Lock Screen, there are no notifications but when I am in my home screen then there is a number in the corner of the app logo. Thank you for reading this response, have a great day/night.

title: Completely Acceptable! (Problem)
text:
Hello! I’d just like to write a review, on the new update. I use teams for school, and work. Today it has updated.. I’m not sure if it’s part of the update, or might be a bug. I had a problem today on a teams meeting, saying.. “Getting Details..” A few minutes later it said “Please try again later.” I had my teacher call me in, since it didn’t work. I had to transfer my meeting from my phone, to my laptop. I love how you can do that, but not with that problem. Please, fix this! 

If I have any further questions, or concerns.. I’ll make sure to edit this. I don’t get why this happened. Again, please fix it! This review is being written quickly, to possibly have this problem fixed. Please, respond! Thanks!

title: I give it props for working mostly.
text: Ok the app does its main job for me tells me when I work but I don’t get notifications about my schedule and why the heck isn’t there an option to see my schedule when I first open the app it’s annoying that I have to click on the notification to then see when I work and when I click on the time I should just be able to see who is working and who isn’t working. I have to go through so many  unnecessary steps just to find that info. Look I get it this app is new bud go look at hotschedule’s app and take a page from their book. Actually take a whole chapter from their book. I don’t just write bad reviews like most people do. Fix these silly little issues and I’m happy to change my opinion. Granted this is really the only feature I use in the app so I’m sure it’s a great app otherwise but this is my main concern.

title: Title: A Fantastic Collaboration Tool - Review of Teams App
text:
Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Reviewer Name: Ray Harris

I couldn't be more thrilled with the Teams app! This incredible collaboration tool has revolutionized the way my team operates and boosts our productivity to new heights. With its impressive range of features, seamless user experience, and excellent customer support, Teams truly deserves a glowing review.

From the moment I started using Teams, I was blown away by its intuitive interface. The app's sleek design makes it a pleasure to navigate, saving us valuable time and effort. Whether it's creating channels for specific projects or participating in video conferences, everything is conveniently organized, ensuring a smooth workflow.

One standout feature is the ability to chat and collaborate in real-time. Instant messaging allows for quick communication within teams, keeping everyone on the same page. It's incredibly efficient, enabling us to tackle urgent issues promptly and avoid any miscommunication.

The video conferencing capabilities are top-notch. Smooth and reliable, Teams

title: Fine, but it could be better
text: The app is fine overall, there’s a seamless integration when you have Outlook, Sharepoint, and OneDrive installed. But the Teams app itself is basically just a copy and paste of the mobile version (same with Outlook). I was hoping it’d be more robust on iPad but it seems they just widened the screen to fit more into the view and didn’t add any additional functions. You can’t even open up a Teams group’s calendar (you get a message that says “this app isn’t available on mobile) so you’re stuck with just your personal calendar but not your group calendars. I’m working on an iPad Pro on the go so I really hope they bring more functionality to iPads, otherwise I’m limited to waiting until I’m back on a desktop.

title: Why?
text: My company uses Teams for much of our data sharing, and this app used to work flawlessly for my purposes. Suddenly, however… I’m unable to upload files from the mobile app. I need to do this at least two to three times a week, and the app made this very easy. Unfortunately now I am forced to take photos with my phone, convert them to files, email them to myself, save them to my PC, then upload to Teams. A process that took a couple of minutes previously is now taking large chunks of my day. And worse, neither safari of chrome will allow me to access Teams from my device, instructing me to use the mobile app instead, which does NOT work. Extremely disappointed with how the app functions now, and honestly wish that my company would rethink our data-sharing platform.

title: Disappointed with the Update
text: My app apparently had an update bc for 2 hrs., I was unable to log in. After uninstalling the app, it finally allowed me to log in… I logged and it’s beyond basic, and I mean that in a bad way. I have several teams threads and usually it will allow me to reply to someone’s message directly by holding that person’s message Dow , selecting “reply”; that option is no longer there!!!! My threads contain a out 15 ppl at least, this function is very much needed! Also, you can no longer see who has viewed your message when you send a message within a group chat, and the only option to acknowledge someone’s message besides replying back is the “thumbs up”! We used hv the options akin to the desktop options for messages, i.e., thumbs up, love, laugh or be angry at the message; now you only hv the option of a colorless thumb. This is a mess!

title: Works well enough. Some frustrations.
text:
I absolutely hate having to constantly clear the notification bandage from the app. If I dismiss the notification in Notification Center, I want that badge to go away — I’ve handled the notification. I believe this is an iOS system function and not under developer control, thought. It’s still frustrating when you get dozens of notifications per day. 

It’s also frustrating that iOS receives notifications before the desktop app does. My phone, over WiFi, gets notified faster than my desktop workstation, wired. 

It’s also frustrating that there are not synced notifications between iOS and desktop. If I read something on my phone, I have to also go “read” it on desktop to make the desktop app stop yelling that there’s a notification.

title: All-In-One BEST TEAM APP
text:
I’ve used it all - GroupMe, Slack, Trello, Google Drive etc. Teams is by far the most inclusive of everything you need. You and your team can chat, have different channels for topics, video call by one click, have all working documents in a “files” tab (so much better than having to search for minutes). Also - for teams niche needs, there is also the option to add third party apps (design apps/communication/sales you name it). It’s design is intuitive. Multiple groups can coexist in harmony by its easily navigable interface.
Whether it’s a school group project, a side passion project, roommates chat, roller blading club or at work, teams supports it all. Would highly recommend!

title: Battery Killer
text:
This is a really sad review for me. This app is probably the best remote meetings and chat platform that exists. The problem? By uninstalling it I’ve literally doubled my battery life. With background processes shut off and a relatively light day of meetings (2, 1 hour meetings) my phone was still dead by 3pm everyday. When I removed this app from my phone, it’s last well into the next day, 1-2am. 

It’s honestly a bit disturbing and shocking how much drain is happening even when the app is inactive - before shutting off background processes it was averaging 5 hours of screen off time. Then when that was flipped off it only went down to 1. The windows app nearly crashes my work computer daily so maybe I should have expected this.

It’s really upsetting that MS is starting to put out some really amazing products - but those products are somehow unusable practically!

title: I need it for work, but there are some key issues
text:
1. Scheduling a meeting on mobile is a nightmare. The iOS wheel UI never works properly when trying to select a meeting time and when sliding the hours or minutes it freezes and continues changing the value and only updates when letting go. Another issue is that when comparing the meeting scheduling to Outlook Mobile, Teams performs far worse. Scheduling a meeting on outlook is so easy, employs better use of meeting conflict visibility and even has a “lite” version of scheduling assistant to see what times are free. Teams mobile has none of these features. Why not just replicate Outlook UI with the Teams color scheme?

2. This app drains my phone battery like nothing else? Is there any room for improvement? I have the newest iPhone and it drains my battery completely with 3-4 meetings that last 30 mins each.

3. During a meeting, it also heats up the phone a lot and when using the speaker output to listen to a meeting, sometimes it starts sounding all robotic like and when I go to check to see what’s wrong with teams/my phone, my phone feels like it’s been in the microwave - something’s wrong with the speaker output

I’ll update my rating when these things get fixed - everything else works great

title: Extremely good organizing, collaboration, and communication abilities.
text: On Windows Desktop, this app is perfection. Everything is all brought into one hub with no fractured issues. It all ties in perfectly. Unfortunately on iOS it's really fractured. I have to install all Office 365 apps to use things fluidly, but that's with a lot of app hopping. It's nice that Planner is seperated out because I don't want all Employees using Teams. They only need to preform tasks. Teams on iOS it's not as straight forward as the Windows Desktop version. It's also not as feature rich as the WinDT version. Planner 😬, also not as feature rich as WinDT. Other than that, it's core purpose (organizing, collaboration, and communication) are on point.

title: App crashes consistently on iPhone X (fixed with the last Teams update)
text:
When the app was working it was great but I have reinstalled the app several times and it keeps crashing. Checked with a co-worker that has an iPhone X and he is experiencing the same thing.

The latest update for Teams resolved the crashing issue. It has been working well since. Keep adding features, it is a great tool. 

Please add the capability to participate in a meeting without being signed in. The inability to participate without sign-in causes issues when a large invite is sent to people that do not have accounts. Most browsers are supported but the experience is inconsistent. A consistent experience could be created if the application didn’t require a sign-in.

title: Good but needs missing end user controls.
text:
I like teams desktop and mobile. Clean interface, no syncing issues. Very effective communication and collaboration tool. However, and this is s big one with thousands of votes.....unbelievable that the end user cannot delete conversations. I don’t want to delete individual messages. If I no longer want or need an entire conversation I should be able to delete it. 

Skype for Business allows companies to disable saving conversations for good reason. I do like that conversations are persistent in Teams. This is a big help over Skype where it would crash and die when I move from desk to meeting room and therefore jump to a new WiFi hotspot.  Let me delete entire conversations Period.

title: It’s teams on your phone ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
text: Like most people I use teams because my work does. It’s a fairly solid app though. Easy enough to use but there’s one feature I use all the time. You can start a call on your phone and then switch to your computer seamlessly and vice versa. You join on the second device and it will prompt you to switch devices. Once you tell it to switch it will join on your new device and automatically disconnect your other device without anyone noticing on the call. This can be great for when you’re in your car still, need to use the bathroom, go get a drink, or want to take a break and go outside but still need to attend a meeting.

title: Pretty good
text: I was not a fan of Teams when I started using it for teaching last year, but it has definitely improved through time. The most recent update is not great, however. I can’t see large gallery when I share my screen. As a second grade teacher, I would find it helpful to make large gallery automatic and visible at all times as well as including the boxes for all participants in the meeting include in large gallery even if their cameras are off. It gives you a better idea of who’s present instantly, especially when teaching a group of 40 or so students. It also makes it more seamless to encourage students with cameras off to turn them on if possible.

title: Junk
text: What a piece of junk.  From my desktop, I go to the Teams website and it wants to know if I’d like to download the app from Google Play or the App Store, uh, no, not from my desktop you idiots.  Next, I get the app on iPad and when I try to accept an invitation to a team it takes me to safari and safari wants to know if I’d like to download the desktop app, uh, no, not on my iPad you idiots.  I can’t accept the invitation from within the app, it keeps taking me to safari, and safari won’t open it, it keeps saying I need the desktop app.  Also, I can’t delete the Team I created on my own, and don’t want anymore.  Again, what a piece of junk.

title: Needs a Multiple message hide function
text:
The app is great. Plenty of qualities that make the app easy to use. 

My only gripe with teams, is the inability to hide multiple messages at once. I work with a very large team and company, and the individual conversations can build up quickly. So having the ability to click edit and check a box next to all the messages I want to hide, would be very helpful! It would save me, and I’m sure many others, time and a bunch of extra clicking! 

Oh, and last thing, and it’s because I’m dealing with it now when trying to save this, get rid of the nickname! Just let someone submit without having to save one.

title: Need more control over notifications
text:
I have to use teams for work so it’s hard to have strong feelings about it. The application is fine enough and gets the job done. 

Unfortunately the notifications are completely unhelpful. Notifications can basically be on or off (either completely annoying or I’m missing messages). You can manage it per channel and set up “quiet hours” for when you’re not working but those features still don’t address a problem of eliminating distractions during the day. 

We need some type of “snooze notifications” for when a rapid fire conversation starts that doesn’t need immediate attention. Right now you can toggle to “silent notifications” in iOS but if I don’t remember to turn them back on in a timely fashion I’ll miss something super important. 

Ideally: 
•I’m notified for a new message
•I can determine if the conversation is something that needs my immediate attention
•if not I could hit a snooze button  (15m/30m/1h) to quiet notifications for that specific chat group while my colleagues talked. 
•after the snooze expired I would receive the next notification

That would totally help me manage my attention and priorities.

title: Not a good app for schools
text: This may be a good app for adults at work, but it is a terrible app for elementary school children and their parents.  It is glitchy and the constant updates fix one problem and create another.  One concrete example of how bad this is for kids is that the hang up button on video calls is right next to the “dots” that lead to features like “raise hand.”  Making it far too easy for kids to accidentally hang up on their class.  This in turn leads to problems rejoining the class which sometimes doesn’t work even when the teacher is clicking on “admit.”  Another example is that the video call does not present its buttons and tools the same way on different devices making it much harder for teachers help kids in real time find the features he or she wants the kids to use.  These are simple design fixes that Microsoft doesn’t pay attention to.

title: App has come a long way
text: I started using Teams, during Covid shutdowns, as a video conferencing tool.  Even with Covid restrictions lifted, many contractors continue to hold weekly or monthly meetings and provide Teams as a digital option to attend, rather than attending in person.  Being able to direct/instant message someone is a convenient feature that allows you to instantly communicate with others, without filling up your email inbox or using a personal phone number.  There are many other features that I have not used, but I look forward to continuing to learn what Teams has to offer.

title: Good idea ...still needs adjustments
text: Overall it’s a really good app and I’ve been using it ever since quarantine from working from home. The main pet peeve I have about the app is the fact when you make a phone call. It does not indicate whether the person is picking up via telephone or video call. When you dial a phone call the person you were dialing can pick up either way. And often times when the phone initially connects it does not show the video call but when I hang up I see the person picked up be via video on their side. So it’s as if they’ve been looking in my ear the entire time. There is a pause when the  call initially connects so you don’t know how the other person connected. Unless u pull back and check after you have started the call.

title: Student here
text: Hi! Because of the pandemic, I’m taking classes online. I only have one issue, and really, it’s more of a preference. It would help me out if the assignments tab just showed you the assignments you need to do. I’d rather not go through every channel to see if I’ve got assignments to do. Also, if all the assignments were listed in one place, it’d be easy to return to that page afterwards. It would make doing my assignments fun if they disappeared from the list once I turned them in. Like “mission accomplished/quest completed”. That kinda format. I’m not a great student so I’m not 100% on top on what I need to do and for what class I need to do it for. I’ve got a system I use so that I PASS each year, the tabs are just throwing me off. Habits 🤷🏽‍♀️.

title: Sometimes okay…Sometimes terrible.
text:
If I have a strong enough cellular signal to log in Teams works, okay.  It is not great at any of the things it claims to do; meaning it is mediocre for messaging, or phone calls, or listening to meeting presentations etc.  Nothing about Teams feels special, it is (mostly) functional on an iPhone; unless the cellular signal is weak… 

then I will not be able to log in. And the next time I try to log in it will have forgotten all of my settings, and I will spend an hour trying to uninstall/reinstall and get logged in so I can see a message from a coworker. Which would have been easy to read as a text or email because those apps are designed to do those tasks.

I will go back to reinstalling Teams and hope it will work this time…

title: Great app ... needs one or two more bugs fixed
text:
First bug, logs you out every few days (which is no lt a problem) but it pretends you’re still logged in ... and doesn’t prompt you to log in either.   You’re rocking along waiting on communication that will never come ... until you try to send a message (and it still pretends you’re logged in) ... until the message fails.  Then, and only then (as far as I can see), does it prompt you to log in.   Then you’re fine for next few days.  

Second ... perhaps this is not a bug ... but a wish item ... I’d like to be able to share my screen from iPad Pro.   No way to do that.  

Third ... the Share Screen is not a uniform icon, placement, across the Mac, Windows, or iOS apps.   When you’re telling someone where the share screen icon is ... and what it looks like ... well, unless they have your same OS, it’s not gonna make sense to them.  

After you figure out the quirks ... this is a highly functional, very handy app.   It’s really incredible for all that it does do.   Sorry my review only seems to list the few (but major) complaints I had.

title: Good with basic issues
text:
My company uses teams for chat and something else for video, but some people setup calls using Teams for video. The video is unstable. It sometimes stalls or drops the can never reconnect. This happens on Mac and Windows even though I have fiber and ISP equipment.
On the iPhone the audio is hard to hear particularly in the car. Seems noise canceling needs work. Sometimes we switch the call to the official video app; the voices sound more natural. In addition to that the chat text size is several times larger than the iPhone settings so either you deal with overly large fonts in Teams or adjust the text size and everything else is small. This app is very much still a work in progress.

title: Great App For Employees Work From Home
text:
This is a great app for employees work from home making team collaborations greater than any other tool in the industry. I can do chat, calls, share documents, customize my teams with different channels to organize my work. Microsoft team is doing a great job helping employees work from home easy during the COVID-19 lockdown. 

Mobile app is one of my best and don’t have to sit in-front of my laptop to read messages or take calls. This is a best app comes with less cost or no cost compared to other providers.

Thanks Microsoft Team for making employees work from home easy & still more productive.

title: MS Teams app for business on iOS
text: I think it’s poor that that MS provide such poor quality of support for issues on there community forum regarding iOS issues especially regarding the inability to function with Apple AirPods Pro! My main problem is that on my IPhone XS Max with AirPods Pro or just the phone go to check the voicemail, I can’t hear anything. So I go to the community forum to find that MS completely abandoned all the conversations about Airpods and AirPods Pro connection issues. I hate to say it but with poor of service from a reputable company during a time where lot’s businesses have switched to a mobile platform unlike another time, I believe businesses should respond by dropping this product fast! As your community forum demonstrates customer service and support for this product doesn’t seem to matter to MS. Sad part is the product overall seems to be a great concept but no follow through.

title: Great app, but has some problems
text:
I really think this app is amazing for online school. My school used it, and I never had any connection issues or crashes. However, if you forget about an assignment, it doesn't notify you. You have to wait for your teachers to let you know, then be screwed unless they're nice enough for you to turn it in late. Also, if you turn it in late, several of my teachers have stated that they don't get notified when you do. Finally, most of the apps built into Teams work well, but some wouldn't open, but it's still an amazing app.

I also hated online school, but because that's a dumb reason to hate on an app, that didn't have any part to why I didn't leave 5 stars.

title: A true and seamless extension of my desktop
text: Yes I work for Microsoft but like any other app I use, it has to work well. And work well it does. It is literally an extension of my desktop. I use my Microsoft Teams mobile app as much as my desktop app and bot are in use full time all day every day. I can switch seamlessly from being in a meeting in my (remote) office to my mobile with no disruption. I can switch a call to my mobile while joining another or vice versa so I can be in two places at one (how else to conquer my day?!). I can respond to a chat during those normally non-productive times when time is simply wasted otherwise. It’s a productivity game changer.

title: External Camera Support
text: The app works well for the most part, with occasional crashes, but nothing too heavy. The worst part about the app is the behavior when docked to an external monitor. Every time I move the Teams app to the display, it flips my video 90 degrees. The only way to keep the video normal is to ONLY use it on the iPad. This needs to be fixed to enable a good experience with an external monitor. If external camera support was enabled, I think it could significantly improve the docked experience. One other major issue I see while docked is the audio source gets locked to whatever your USB device is. The only alternative is to undock or use headphones. If the docked experience is fixed, I would definitely rate the app higher.

title: Some issues with notifications with iOS
text:
Despite my every effort to set notifications as banner and persistent on my Apple phone, I still struggle to get notification when files are added and certain sub-Teams add comments 😩 Therefore, I have to go hunting for them. This is a huge inconvenience and my delay in response conveys to my teammates and boss that I don’t care.  Just to clarify, I have “followed” each thread specifically and have also gone into my settings on my iphone to allow all notifications from Teams.

Beyond that, the functionality, speed, and intuition of app are excellent for my team’s needs. Large resort business with dozens of managers on Team.

title: Not that good
text: I downloaded Teams for when I had to do school online. It was good and everything went smoothly until now. For some reason, the chat suddenly disabled and I couldn’t chat anymore. I had thought it happened with everyone else but the other students could still chat. I find the really offensive because I’m a mobile user and I find this unfair. Also, it is really laggy when we try to talk while others are behind and others are ahead. Even my teachers are getting tired with it and are considering we use Zoom once again. You also tell us at the end of every meeting to say what was the problem and if anything should be fixed. But then, the next day, nothing has changed. I’m sorry if I sound bratty or anything but this is the only app that I can do my classes on and it would be terrible if something changed because of that.

title: It’s a nice clock
text: This is a great app. I started using it about 2-4 years ago when Covid hit. Now I use it everyday day. I love the video feature so I get to talk with my family and friends when I’m off work but they are still at work. It’s easier to keep in touch with my little ones. And it is easy for me to get in contact with my mother. Because she uses Teams at her job too. I think Teams is a family oriented app. Because inappropriate comments and activities are reported. So I get to use it for things that I like to do like surfing the net and online shopping. And this app is very user friendly.

title: Filling the gaps
text: I do a job that requires I make life and death decisions in a moment. I have to make the decisions on my own but I can’t do that without a team behind me for support and consultation nobody should take on the liability of somebody else’s life without getting a second opinion. When Covid hit and this job became remote it became much harder to make that happen we could see clients we couldn’t necessarily have a team. Teams has made it possible now I still feel connected to my team like I’m in the office with them in real time, we talk, we consult and it makes sure we stay connected via chats, calendars, team messages and alerts and so much more.

title: Nearly perfect
text:
Does everything I need to do, especially in a remote work environment.

I would love it if you could display everyone’s working hours on the calendar. It can be a lot of work to schedule meetings with people scattered throughout the globe. It’s helpful that we can find their time zone, but I still have to do a lot of arithmetic to find a good time to meet.

Additionally, we have people in Asia who work uncommon hours to support the US and other countries. So, knowing the time zone doesn’t always help. Ideally, we could enter our normal working hours into TEAMS for graphical display when scheduling.

title: Re: Teams App Review
text:
Teams is consistently updating it’s list of integrations to offer!

I want to use Teams for all of my biz communication!

The devs are figuring out how to notify me when I’m using a platform that can be integrated, in real-time. 

The platform is missing a specific funneling-cadence for tracking and forecasting progression, but I’m certain that’s due to growing pains.

The mobile app could be more IOS friendly, but the tech-lagging is understandable, considering the source. 

Overall, the devs deserve a round of applause!

It’s a terrific platform for optimizing multiple communication methods like emails, CRM’s, and clouds management.

As it continues to mature, I’m expecting this platform to integrate an optimized AI mix and pivot into more of a Personal Assistant for customers.

If I’m in the ballpark with my review, and Teams is close to implementing a GTM product with the following milestones, it could soon become an everyday app for me:

1) Adapts to my current “Work-from-Home” lifestyle with a Personalized Assistant.

2) Optimizes my Work/ Life balance, streamlining all of my online activity, with personalized suggestions.

3) Secures, monitors, and protects my IP-PI database, consistently, with an All-In-1 Security Assistant.

title: HATE IT
text:
Hi so you might be thinking everyone else gave a 5 star review but I gave only 2 stars so here I go plz read the whole review and you will understand so I use this app for my online classes and sometimes it just cuts the call for no reason and I miss something every time it does that (it does that a LOT )and sometimes the screen just goes black and I can’t see the notes and the worst problem in the assignments when I try to upload more then 1 at a time it takes forever to upload and if I do it 1 by one it is time waste and I doesn’t let me upload a video more than 55 seconds which is a bummer for my assignments not the best app 

 Edit : now it just crashes every time I open the app I am In holidays so now it’s okay but my school starts soon WORST APP EVER DO NOT DOWNLOAD 

 Edit : first day of school after holidays and it won’t let me attach anything HOW am I supposed to finish my assignments ANd it still sometimes crashes I have to shutdown and restart ITS ANNOYING AND NO RESPONSE from the DEVELOPER TEAm 0STAR and now it says I need permission to join a meeting I go to settings and everything is perfect I allowed every thing 

 BTW I am not a Karen this is something likened to my education that’s why I am very concerned about this

title: Wish my school would stop using this.
text:
I have no clue why schools continue to use this app. It is slow, and in every class there’s at least one person who has an issue joining a meeting. There’s also the issue of meetings not appearing: sometimes the purple camera icon appears but when I tap it and it enters the channel and chat, there is no meeting there, nor is there a join button. 
Microsoft apps are always heavy and slow. Everything takes too long to load, and this also applies to the computer versions of the apps. TEAMS is not an exception. It is slow, clunky, and I really don’t get why my school can’t use something else. Not worth even the one star I’m forced to give it. Literally, I have never had one problem with Zoom. Name one Microsoft app or desktop program, and there’s always a problem. If I could delete it, I would, but I’m forced to keep it.

title: Super great app for Distance learning!
text: As a student doing online distance learning this has been extremely helpful and have run into very little issues but am overall satisfied. But one issue I have is that we can’t change our names. I know multiple students who use different names and pronouns and it can be very stressful for them to see their dead names on the screen and students and teachers accidentally using them instead of the names they go by. If there could be an option to be able to change our names so people can stop seeing the dead names and see the names they go by it can be extremely helpful for everyone to stop using their dead names. Thank you!

title: Great App - Could use some minor improvements
text:
The app is great overall, however when video is connected through another device, the "Teams/Chat/Meetings/Phone" bar across the bottom is no longer visible. 

Additionally, the app could use the ability to do Picture in Picture mode and keep the camera on while in the smaller window - similar to FaceTime, this would allow me to take notes/code while having a video chat with coworkers.

Lastly, the alerts from webhook allow reactions on the desktop app but those are not visible on the mobile version. I use this for tracking events that need action of supervisor approvals. Would be nice to have this visibility when away from my laptop

title: Good but lacking in student/parent communication
text: I wish you could send an individual chat all at once to multiple users like a bcc email. I know you can post announcements but my students don’t really respond to those. They are embarrassed so if I could mass send an individual chat it would really help with student communication. As well as SMS messaging so I can send messages to parents and students who don’t have data/wifi to use Teams but can text. This would greatly improve equity for low income students and families. And many of my parents are Spanish speaking so it would be easier to translate info via text vs having to call them.

title: Perfect app
text:
Very easy to operate. We use it at my work to communicate with other coworkers, our store as a whole, or other stores in our company. Makes it extremely easy to make calls, video chats, or just simple messages back and forth. 

Only issue, and it’s a minor one, is that I have to keep signing in every couple weeks which gets super annoying. Other than that, no problems at all. If there are any bad reviews, it’s probably because they don’t know how to work the app, or their phones/software is very outdated, to which they’ll try to blame the app. No issues here.

title: We need help Microsoft!
text:
Although it does help with productivity there are serious issues that limit the ability to use the app on mobile or desktop efficiently. Namely
1. Search via mobile - we desperately need search to be refined. I can search amongst the teams in the mobile app for the name of a team itself and the team does not pop up, just links to files with the name in it. 
2. Sorting - no capability to sort teams for mobile. Beyond frustrating. Make item number 1 even worse. Without the sort teams feature we have to manually manage the team positions by moving them up or down the list. This is terrible. 
3. Search via desktop app - when searching in the desktop app for a team by name you will pull up the team but it will not show the teams general channel. This is unacceptable.

title: Amazing application to help with any work related help
text: We started using Microsoft teams at the beginning of Covid last year and it has really changed the way we do things in veterinary medicine. It has changed how we communicate with our staff, our clients and our doctors and being from a large doctor hospital, which is two floors, it has really made us much more efficient in the way we do our daily tasks. The best thing I love about it is that I can use it to work remotely from home as long as other colleagues. With the help of this new technology and other upcoming applications it seems that the future is bright for veterinary medicine.

title: Valuable tool for work on the go.
text:
For me, the best use of Teams is on the desktop. But the ability to still work effectively and efficiently on the mobile app speaks to the quality design, workflow, and continued improvement that Microsoft’s has done to empower the multiplatform experience. 

The design is of high-quality and resembles the desktop experience in just the right ways to enable a seamless switch and ease of use between the two platforms. But meaningful consideration was given to the mobile app to make it usable in ways that are most intuitive for, in my case, the iPhone.

title: Cumbersome and frustrating
text:
“Download the app for a better experience” but I downloaded it to my tablet and it doesn’t work as well as the online version when. Settings are so confusing. I can’t never figure out how to change display name during meeting. During an important meeting I spent most of the hour trying to figure out how to mute the chat since it keeps beeping every time someone types a message. 
It says “log in to your Microsoft account to change settings” so I go online to Microsoft sign-in and enter my work email and it reads “this account doesn’t exist”, even though that’s the one I use to log in to all microsoft apps. 
Also, sometimes I can see myself in a small screen on the corner, sometimes I can’t, sometimes I can see everyone, sometimes I can’t. Randomly, I see to screens and I have to choose which one to close. Frustrating.

title: Best app ever
text:
Micro stuff is like the best thing ever if you want to meet with someone like I am a student and I literally can be on teams I can be like like like calling my teacher all day it’s the best thing if you want to call someone and post on the chat it’s it’s the best because you can put like background and all of that it’s the best thing ever you should download it because it actually works if you like in work like if you’re a student and you need to like do it from home if your virtual like it’s the best 
thing if you did do schoolwork or anything that you need to do it with even my sister uses the best thing ever you should download it!

title: This app gets worse every time I open it.
text: I swear every time there’s an update the app evolves backwards 1 year.  Now the pictures and toolbar on the bottom stay there no matter what, and there’s nothing in the settings to turn that off. The screen also times out, and the screen goes black if you move your finger or anything else (even just holding it there) over the proximity sensor on the top! Why would the screen time out on a VIDEO CALL app. There’s very little you can do in settings to fix any of these things. This app would actually be half decent if the devs fixed these things but they’re aiming it at the larger iPhones with big screens so that big bar that takes up 1/4 of the screen at all times wouldn’t be as noticeable on phones like the iPhone 12 that has a long screen. I have the SE 2020 and it’s just impossible to use. Please fix!!!

title: I love Teams but it can be even better!
text:
I love Teams. However, talking specifically about the planner, I think it could be even better. For instance, 1) the tool should allow adding more than one file at the same time to the tasks; 2) the planner should allow adding the tasks to the everyday calendar so we can better plan our day; 3) alternatively, in the list view the star date should appear; 4) even better there should be notification for the tasks starting date nor only the tasks that will be due soon.

Other than this, it is a fantastic tool.
